attributes.action: Mr Johnson needs to review his position.
attributes.additional_details: It is a matter of honour and integrity in the face of tens of thousands of unnecessary deaths of our citizens caused by the government's unpreparedness and inaction.
attributes.background:
CONSERVATIVE PM RESIGNATIONS
1957 Eden:16 UK citizens died in the Suez debacle 
1963 MacMillan: the Profumo scandal: no deaths
1990 Thatcher: failing to win a vote: no deaths 
2016 Cameron: Brexit vote: no deaths (yet)
2021:Johnson? at least 30,000 died so far!

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked, resign or for a vote of no confidence.

If you're concerned about a particular policy or decision that's the responsibility of Government or the House of Commons, you could start a petition about that.  

You might like to sign this petition calling for a public inquiry into the handling of coronavirus:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302576
